wikipedia_page.main: William Mortimer (2 April 1874 – 31 October 1916) was an English rugby union forward who played club rugby for Marlborough Nomads and was capped for England, and was part of the British Isles tour to South Africa in 1896.

link_mentions.page: 1896 British Lions tour to South Africa
List of England national rugby union players

response: * William Mortimer (rugby union) (1874–1916), English rugby union forward
* William Mortimer (cricketer) (1833–1916), English cricketer and British Army officer
